senses.sense_definition: A large shrub or small tree, Prunus spinosa, native to Europe, western Asia, and north Africa, known for its dark bark and sharp thorns.

examples.text: The hedgerow was thick with white blossoms from the <w>blackthorn</w> in early spring.
Birds often build their nests deep inside the <w>blackthorn</w> for protection against predators.

senses.sense_definition: A walking stick or staff made from the hard wood of the blackthorn tree.

examples.text: The old farmer leaned on his polished <w>blackthorn</w> as he watched the sheep.
He carried a heavy <w>blackthorn</w> for support while hiking up the steep hill.

senses.sense_definition: A village and civil parish in the Cherwell district of Oxfordshire, England.

examples.text: They decided to visit the quiet village of <w>Blackthorn</w> during their tour of the countryside.
The local map shows the boundaries of the parish of <w>Blackthorn</w> quite clearly.
